title: From Zozibini Tunzi to Khanyi Mbau, here are 8 celebrity red carpet looks we spotted at the AFI Fashion Week
text:
Click, click, tell us who you are wearing tonight!

The African Fashion International (AFI) Fashion Week took place this past weekend at the Sandton Convention Centr an TV presenter and actress, Thembisa Mdoda, did a superb job hosting the red carpet.

With the hashtag #IAMAFRICA, South African celebrities took to the red carpet, dressed for the evening presenting what being African means to them. Stars such as model and presenter K Naomi, African Fashion Unite co-chair and current reigning Miss South Africa Zozibini Tunzi, actress Samkelo Ndlovu, model Rosette Mogomotsi Ncwana, TV and Radio personality Khanyi Mbau, actress Zandile Msutwana as well as model and entrepreneur Babalwa Mneno gracing the red carpet with bold colours.

READ MORE: This AFI Fashion Week we're b(l)ending the makeup rules and this beauty authority approves

Thembisa Mdoda

The host showed up in a Dainty Frocks gown, looking absolutely stunning in a pink and turquoise African print.

Zozibini Tunzi

The reigning Miss SA showed up in a red sequin two-piece, with a black lacy top and leopar heels.

K Naomi

The stunning K Naomi, looked fashionable as always with a pink Diane-Paris dress, black pointed heels and a shoulder-length bob. We couln't help put give her extra points for the simple yet elegant look.

Samkelo Ndlovu

The gorgeous Samkelo showed some legs with her sequin jumpsuit and peach platform heels.

READ MORE: 5 unconventional trends we already can't wait to try from AFI Fashion Week





Khanyi Mabau

Ever the trend-setter, TV presenter and actress, Khanyi didn't disappoint in a nude dress, with brown lace shoulders matching her skin tone with tassels hanging from above the knee and sparkling golden peep toe heels. The see-through number was the perfect marriage of red carpet glamour and a touch of Khanyi's personal style.

Rosette Mogomotsi Ncwana

Model Rosette did justice to her red-hot outfit which, paired with a matching lipstick, made for the perfect red-carpet look. We're all for the combo of the blazer with the six-layered skirt.

READ MORE: Reimagining the bridal veil – here are 4 bold veils for millennial brides to try out straight from the runway

Zandile Msutwana

Actress Zandile attended the show in a black dress with a traditional print bow and belt, matching the look to a black peep-toe heel. Her minimalist make-up complemented the look.

Babalwa Mneno

Draped in House of Jahdara, the stunning ‘Barbielish’ stepped out in an inticate ensemble - a mixture of lace, dark nude and black tassels. We totally approve of this look.

description: Click, click, tell us who you are wearing tonight!
